properties.name: Day 1 (24/08) Brighton to Le Mans
properties.description: Posted by TeamsnhThis year’s event will start on the English riviera in the fair city of Brighton. With all the cars lined up on the seafront there will be ample opportunity to soak up the atmosphere and meet new friends as the teams complete their registration. The Brakeaway participants will then split in to two groups, with one heading to Portsmouth to begin their two-day party cruise to Spain, and the other hopping over the channel in a mad dash through France to beat them down there, fittingly ending the day in Le Mans, home of the world famous endurance race.

properties.name: Day 2 (25/08) - Le Mans to San Sebastian
properties.description: Posted by TeamsnhIt\'s a early start for the drivers as they begin the grueling 400 mile journey down through the Pyrenees and into northern Spain, hoping to reach their second stop-over, San Sebastian, before nightfall.

properties.name: Day 3 (26/08) San Sebastian to Salamanca
properties.description: Posted by TeamsnhAround 8am our one-boat armada hits the shores of Spain with it\'s occupants making the short hop over to meet with the rest of the drivers waiting for them at San Sebastian. Reunited, the rally then heads west in to the Castile and León region to the countless cafes, restaurants and bars of the inspiring beautiful city of Salamanca.

properties.name: Day 4 27/08 Salamanca to Granada
properties.description: Posted by TeamsnhDay four sees our Red Bull-powered convoy travel down to the southern city of Granada in the exotic and colourful Andalusia region. A former capital of the last Islamic kingdom in Spain, it is now considered one of the capitals of modern day student living - and we all know what that means. Flanked on one side by the Sierra Nevada mountain range and stuffed with Moorish and Morisco architecture, there is still plenty to see and do besides sampling the local night-life.

properties.name: Day 5 (28/08) - Granada to Valencia
properties.description: Posted by TeamsnhNow starting to forget fundamental knowledge such as where they live and the names of their pets, our drivers begin the next leg of their journey, this time heading north to the coastal city of Valencia.

properties.name: Day 6 (29/08) Valencia to Buñol (for La Tomatina)
properties.description: Posted by TeamsnhAnd so we reach the final day of the Student Brake Away 2007 and what a way to end it - one of the biggest and definitely most bonkers festivals in the world - La Tomatina. Kicking off in the tiny village of Buñol at 11am, we want to show those Spaniards what going berserk is all about. Can our road-weary Brake Away Army muster enough strength to defend their honour against 30,000 mad, tomato-lobbing men and women? There\'s only one way to find out - let battle commence!

properties.name: Day 7 (30/08) Buñol to Whereever
properties.description: Posted by TeamsnhWith the tomato festival just a distant memory of yesterday, Team SNH but now brake away from the gumball rally, as other cars return back to England, we press on in our Taxi heading to Italy, Germany, Belgium, France (again) and Returning back to UK ending in Canterbury
